passages.text: Ahem. I see you have become adept at fishing for monkfish. If you would accept this humble servant's advice, try an alternative catch. The shrimp off the north coast, for example, are quite tasty and abundant this time of year, and they can be caught with the cheapest of bait. [[Let's hear about some fish.]][[Identify and record fish]][[Leave]]
passages.name: Untitled Passage

passages.text: In the Old Histories, it's told that shrimp represent the youth of the island. Before the lucrative fishing trade, couples with no children would actively fish for shrimp as an omen that they would soon be blessed with one. While those who wished to avoid children of their own would customarily cast shrimp back into the ocean after catching one.
passages.name: Let's hear about some fish.
